name: portainer
description: Portainer is a self-hosted management UI for Docker, Kubernetes, and container environments. It simplifies container deployments, monitoring, and orchestrating services across endpoints.
features: Container management: Deploy, start, stop, and remove Docker containers through a web interface.
Kubernetes support: Manage Kubernetes clusters with visual tools for deployments and services.
Stack deployment: Deploy multi-container applications using Docker Compose or Kubernetes manifests.
Image management: Pull, push, and manage container images from registries.
Volume management: Create and manage persistent storage volumes for container data.
Network configuration: Set up and manage container networks with custom configurations.
User access control: Define teams and roles with granular permissions for multi-user environments.
Registry management: Connect to multiple container registries including Docker Hub and private registries.
Template library: Deploy applications quickly using pre-configured templates for common services.
Resource monitoring: View CPU, memory, and network usage for containers and hosts.
Log viewing: Access container logs directly in the interface for troubleshooting.
Multi-endpoint: Manage multiple Docker hosts and Kubernetes clusters from a single dashboard.
